“You can’t remain like this,” Raskolnikov said, his voice harsh.  
Sonia looked at him, confused. “What for? What’s all this for?”  
“Because you must face reality. You can’t cry like a child.”  
She wrung her hands, tears streaming down her face.  
“What’s to be done?” she sobbed.  
“Break what must be broken. Take the suffering on yourself.”  
“Freedom and power,” he continued, eyes fierce.  
“Remember that. That’s my farewell message.”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov urges Sonia to confront harsh realities and take decisive action for their future, emphasizing the need for power and freedom.
